SK_ID_CURR: <u>Description</u>: ID of loan in our sample
CNT_CHILDREN: <u>Description</u>: Number of children the client has
REGION_POPULATION_RELATIVE: <u>Description</u>: Normalized population of region where client lives (higher number means the client lives in more populated region)
DAYS_BIRTH: <u>Description</u>: Client's age in days at the time of application
DAYS_EMPLOYED: <u>Description</u>: How many days before the application the person started current employment
DAYS_REGISTRATION: <u>Description</u>: How many days before the application did client change his registration
DAYS_ID_PUBLISH: <u>Description</u>: How many days before the application did client change the identity document with which he applied for the loan
CNT_FAM_MEMBERS: <u>Description</u>: How many family members does client have
REGION_RATING_CLIENT: <u>Description</u>: Our rating of the region where client lives (1,2,3)
REGION_RATING_CLIENT_W_CITY: <u>Description</u>: Our rating of the region where client lives with taking city into account (1,2,3)
HOUR_APPR_PROCESS_START: <u>Description</u>: Approximately at what hour did the client apply for the loan
REG_REGION_NOT_LIVE_REGION: <u>Description</u>: Flag if client's permanent address does not match contact address (1=different, 0=same, at region level)
REG_REGION_NOT_WORK_REGION: <u>Description</u>: Flag if client's permanent address does not match work address (1=different, 0=same, at region level)
LIVE_REGION_NOT_WORK_REGION: <u>Description</u>: Flag if client's contact address does not match work address (1=different, 0=same, at region level)
REG_CITY_NOT_LIVE_CITY: <u>Description</u>: Flag if client's permanent address does not match contact address (1=different, 0=same, at city level)
REG_CITY_NOT_WORK_CITY: <u>Description</u>: Flag if client's permanent address does not match work address (1=different, 0=same, at city level)
LIVE_CITY_NOT_WORK_CITY: <u>Description</u>: Flag if client's contact address does not match work address (1=different, 0=same, at city level)
EXT_SOURCE_2: <u>Description</u>: Normalized score from external data source
EXT_SOURCE_3: <u>Description</u>: Normalized score from external data source
YEARS_BEGINEXPLUATATION_AVG: <u>Description</u>: Normalized information about building where the client lives, What is average (_AVG suffix), modus (_MODE suffix), median (_MEDI suffix) apartment size, common area, living area, age of building, number of elevators, number of entrances, state of the building, number of floor
FLOORSMAX_AVG: <u>Description</u>: Normalized information about building where the client lives, What is average (_AVG suffix), modus (_MODE suffix), median (_MEDI suffix) apartment size, common area, living area, age of building, number of elevators, number of entrances, state of the building, number of floor
YEARS_BEGINEXPLUATATION_MODE: <u>Description</u>: Normalized information about building where the client lives, What is average (_AVG suffix), modus (_MODE suffix), median (_MEDI suffix) apartment size, common area, living area, age of building, number of elevators, number of entrances, state of the building, number of floor
FLOORSMAX_MODE: <u>Description</u>: Normalized information about building where the client lives, What is average (_AVG suffix), modus (_MODE suffix), median (_MEDI suffix) apartment size, common area, living area, age of building, number of elevators, number of entrances, state of the building, number of floor
YEARS_BEGINEXPLUATATION_MEDI: <u>Description</u>: Normalized information about building where the client lives, What is average (_AVG suffix), modus (_MODE suffix), median (_MEDI suffix) apartment size, common area, living area, age of building, number of elevators, number of entrances, state of the building, number of floor
FLOORSMAX_MEDI: <u>Description</u>: Normalized information about building where the client lives, What is average (_AVG suffix), modus (_MODE suffix), median (_MEDI suffix) apartment size, common area, living area, age of building, number of elevators, number of entrances, state of the building, number of floor
TOTALAREA_MODE: <u>Description</u>: Normalized information about building where the client lives, What is average (_AVG suffix), modus (_MODE suffix), median (_MEDI suffix) apartment size, common area, living area, age of building, number of elevators, number of entrances, state of the building, number of floor
OBS_30_CNT_SOCIAL_CIRCLE: <u>Description</u>: How many observation of client's social surroundings with observable 30 DPD (days past due) default
DEF_30_CNT_SOCIAL_CIRCLE: <u>Description</u>: How many observation of client's social surroundings defaulted on 30 DPD (days past due)
DEF_60_CNT_SOCIAL_CIRCLE: <u>Description</u>: How many observation of client's social surroundings defaulted on 60 (days past due) DPD
DAYS_LAST_PHONE_CHANGE: <u>Description</u>: How many days before application did client change phone
AMT_REQ_CREDIT_BUREAU_HOUR: <u>Description</u>: Number of enquiries to Credit Bureau about the client one hour before application
AMT_REQ_CREDIT_BUREAU_DAY: <u>Description</u>: Number of enquiries to Credit Bureau about the client one day before application (excluding one hour before application)
AMT_REQ_CREDIT_BUREAU_WEEK: <u>Description</u>: Number of enquiries to Credit Bureau about the client one week before application (excluding one day before application)
AMT_REQ_CREDIT_BUREAU_MON: <u>Description</u>: Number of enquiries to Credit Bureau about the client one month before application (excluding one week before application)
AMT_REQ_CREDIT_BUREAU_QRT: <u>Description</u>: Number of enquiries to Credit Bureau about the client 3 month before application (excluding one month before application)
AMT_REQ_CREDIT_BUREAU_YEAR: <u>Description</u>: Number of enquiries to Credit Bureau about the client one day year (excluding last 3 months before application)

Description: Normalized information about building where the client lives, What is average (_AVG suffix), modus (_MODE suffix), median (_MEDI suffix) apartment size, common area, living area, age of building, number of elevators, number of entrances, state of the building, number of floor
Valeur: Yes
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_ANNUITY_min: <u>Description</u>: Valeur minimale de: Annuity of previous application
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_ANNUITY_max: <u>Description</u>: Valeur maximale de: Annuity of previous application
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_ANNUITY_mean: <u>Description</u>: Moyenne de: Annuity of previous application
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_ANNUITY_var: <u>Description</u>: Variance de: Annuity of previous application
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_ANNUITY_sum: <u>Description</u>: Somme de: Annuity of previous application
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_CREDIT_min: <u>Description</u>: Valeur minimale de: Final credit amount on the previous application. This differs from AMT_APPLICATION in a way that the AMT_APPLICATION is the amount for which the client initially applied for, but during our approval process he could have received different amount - AMT_CREDIT
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_CREDIT_max: <u>Description</u>: Valeur maximale de: Final credit amount on the previous application. This differs from AMT_APPLICATION in a way that the AMT_APPLICATION is the amount for which the client initially applied for, but during our approval process he could have received different amount - AMT_CREDIT
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_CREDIT_mean: <u>Description</u>: Moyenne de: Final credit amount on the previous application. This differs from AMT_APPLICATION in a way that the AMT_APPLICATION is the amount for which the client initially applied for, but during our approval process he could have received different amount - AMT_CREDIT
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_CREDIT_var: <u>Description</u>: Variance de: Final credit amount on the previous application. This differs from AMT_APPLICATION in a way that the AMT_APPLICATION is the amount for which the client initially applied for, but during our approval process he could have received different amount - AMT_CREDIT
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_AMT_CREDIT_sum: <u>Description</u>: Somme de: Final credit amount on the previous application. This differs from AMT_APPLICATION in a way that the AMT_APPLICATION is the amount for which the client initially applied for, but during our approval process he could have received different amount - AMT_CREDIT
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_HOUR_APPR_PROCESS_S: <u>Description</u>: Valeur minimale de: Approximately at what day hour did the client apply for the previous application
<u>Description</u>: Valeur maximale de: Approximately at what day hour did the client apply for the previous application
<u>Description</u>: Moyenne de: Approximately at what day hour did the client apply for the previous application
<u>Description</u>: Variance de: Approximately at what day hour did the client apply for the previous application
<u>Description</u>: Somme de: Approximately at what day hour did the client apply for the previous application
PREVIOUS_APPLICATION_NFLAG_LAST_APPL_IN_: <u>Description</u>: Valeur minimale de: Flag if the application was the last application per day of the client. Sometimes clients apply for more applications a day. Rarely it could also be error in our system that one application is in the database twice

<u>Description</u>: Valeur maximale de: Flag if the application was the last application per day of the client. Sometimes clients apply for more applications a day. Rarely it could also be error in our system that one application is in the database twice

<u>Description</u>: Moyenne de: Flag if the application was the last application per day of the client. Sometimes clients apply for more applications a day. Rarely it could also be error in our system that one application is in the database twice

<u>Description</u>: Variance de: Flag if the application was the last application per day of the client. Sometimes clients apply for more applications a day. Rarely it could also be error in our system that one application is in the database twice

<u>Description</u>: Somme de: Flag if the application was the last application per day of the client. Sometimes clients apply for more applications a day. Rarely it could also be error in our system that one application is in the database twice

POS_CASH_MONTHS_BALANCE_min: <u>Description</u>: Valeur minimale de: Month of balance relative to application date (-1 means the information to the freshest monthly snapshot, 0 means the information at application - often it will be the same as -1 as many banks are not updating the information to Credit Bureau regularly )
POS_CASH_MONTHS_BALANCE_max: <u>Description</u>: Valeur maximale de: Month of balance relative to application date (-1 means the information to the freshest monthly snapshot, 0 means the information at application - often it will be the same as -1 as many banks are not updating the information to Credit Bureau regularly )
POS_CASH_MONTHS_BALANCE_mean: <u>Description</u>: Moyenne de: Month of balance relative to application date (-1 means the information to the freshest monthly snapshot, 0 means the information at application - often it will be the same as -1 as many banks are not updating the information to Credit Bureau regularly )

POS_CASH_MONTHS_BALANCE_sum: <u>Description</u>: Somme de: Month of balance relative to application date (-1 means the information to the freshest monthly snapshot, 0 means the information at application - often it will be the same as -1 as many banks are not updating the information to Credit Bureau regularly )
